RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Ohio Registere d Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FISHING FOR FUN set the pace along the inside through the first turn, matched strides with LED TASSO before a half and into the stretch, shook clear before the furlong marker and won under a strong hand ride. ON SPOT pressed the early pace between horses two wide, dropped back and shifted out before a half, came on again in the five path through the stretch and finished well clear for second. LED TASSO had speed from the start three wide, went up to challenge the winner before a half, dueled with that one into the stretch then weakened. SILVER MATT passed tiring rivals. ARCHARCH CAT with the second flight two wide, failed to respond. DRINKSONTHEBEACH with the second flight along the inside, was through after a half. SOAKING WET was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Drinksonthebeach
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, inside, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Archarch Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, 2 wide, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Fishing for Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: led, dueled inside, shook clear upper stretch, strong hand ride

ENTRY.NAME: Soaking Wet
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: On Spot
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, dropped back, came again 5path, clear 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Led Tasso
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 3 wide, battled 2 wide, weakened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Claiming Purse 17900. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACCURATE had speed from the start four wide, began to close ground three then two wide through the turn, drifted to the six path, gained a narrow lead at the furlong marker and shook clear late under strong handling. TWINSPIREDJOEY was bumped at the start, set a pressured pace three then two wide then along the inside until mid stretch and was no match for winner. ORLEANS STORM pressed the early pace along the rail, took back before the turn, shifted outside rivals, swung wide and passed a tiring foe near the middle of the racetrack. THANKSDAD broke outward bumping the runner up, pressed the pace two wide then along the inside through the stretch then weakened. IMA BELIEVER trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Orleans Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed rail, dropped back, swung wide, passed tiring rival 7path

ENTRY.NAME: Thanksdad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, bumped start, pressed 2w, inside, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Twinspiredjoey
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta Racing Stable and Quinteros Delia
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, set pressured pace 2w, inside, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Accurate
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 4w, surged 3 wide turn, drifted 6p, late lead, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Believer
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 18300. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7, 500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROPHETESS stumbled at the start, was never far back, saved ground into the turn, shifted out three wide before the quarter pole, rallied to make the lead in upper stretch and drew clear under a hand ride. LARSA dueled for the lead along the inside into the stretch then was no match for the winner. WHERETHERE'SSMOKE pressed the early pace three wide, gained a narrow advantage on the turn then was outfinished. BAREFOOT BEACH trailed into the turn then found her best stride late in the five path. PROPER ETIQUETTE had brief speed. SCARLETT'S AWISH matched strides for the lead two wide into the turn and was through after a half.

ENTRY.NAME: Larsa
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Prophetess
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, close inside, angled out turn, rallied 3w, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlett's Awish
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, 2 wide, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Wherethere'ssmoke
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Proper Etiquette
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.NAME: Barefoot Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, best stride late 5path

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 67. Allowance Purse 35800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEECHI was fractious in the gate, broke alertly, was bumped soon after the start by DANZA MAGIC, set the pace off the rail for a quarter, dropped back on the turn, drifted to the six path then came on again to make the lead in deep stretch and drew clear under brisk handling. DANZA MAGIC drifted in bumping the winner soon after the start, prompted the pace three wide, dropped back to trail on the turn then came on again through the final furlong and finished second best. CUE THE BAND hopped out of the gate, was bumped then stumbled, rushed up four wide to make the lead after a quarter, set the pace until mid stretch then was outfinished. MARGARITA CINCO bumped at the start, rushed to contention along the inside to press the pace before a quarter, remained a sharp threat until deep stretch then was used up. THE RIDER OF DANZA MAGIC LODGED A CLAIM OF FOUL AGAINST THE RIDER OF THE WINNER FOR ALLEGED INTEFERENCE SHORTLY AFTER THE START. AFTER REVIEW THE STEWARDS UPHELD THE ORIGINAL ORDER OF FINISH.

ENTRY.NAME: Neechi
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, bumped leaving chute, led, drop back, came again

ENTRY.NAME: Cue the Band
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped, bumped, stumbled start, rushed 4 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Margarita Cinco
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, rushed rail, used up,

ENTRY.NAME: Danza Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted in,bumped chute,3w, dropped back,came again,claimed foul

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 24, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RECKLESS L J stalked the pace into the stretch, closed rapidly three wide through the final sixteenth of a mile and got up in the final strides. HANSENATION unhurried early, closed with a rush along the rail through the stretch and just missed. ROYAL'D away alertly, set all the pace, widened on the turn and was caught in the final stages. SPIN DOCTOR allowed to settle, swung wide and closed some ground. BIG OHIO trailed into the stretch, swung wide and closed gap late. JACK BE FAST went evenly. RONNI'S STORM away alertly, chased the pace into the stretch and weakened late. THE MAN CAN inside, failed to respond. DYNAMITE CLOUD was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: The Man Can
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamite Cloud
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Ohio
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, swung wide, closed gap late

ENTRY.NAME: Reckless L J
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, closed fast, 3 wide, up in final strides,

ENTRY.NAME: Hansenation
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, closed with a rush rail, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Spin Doctor
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, swung wide, late gain,

ENTRY.NAME: Jack Be Fast
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Ronni's Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, chased, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Royal'd
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, drew off turn, caught

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 24, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,00 0 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VISKI JONES allowed to settle, closed willingly three wide through the far turn and into the stretch, made the lead before the furlong marker and drew off under right handed urging. GILES pressed the pace two wide for six furlongs, made the lead briefly then was no match for the winner. THE DRAKE close up along the inside, angled out to the five path entering the stretch and was outfinished. MASTER OF WAR advanced two wide before a half then leveled off. GOOD IDEA offered a mild bid along the inside nearing the top of the stretch then failed to sustain that bid. AULD LANGE SYNE made the lead soon after the start, set the pace along the inside for six furlongs then gave way late. YONDERING broke slowly and was outrun. STAGE READY broke slowly, was a sharp threat three wide then through after a half.

ENTRY.NAME: The Drake
ENTRY.COMMENT: close inside, angled out 5path, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Auld Lange Syne
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 1/4 pole, gave way late

ENTRY.NAME: Yondering
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Good Idea
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move inside, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Viski Jones
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, closed willingly, 3 wide, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Master of War
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, 2 wide, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Giles
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, led top lane, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Stage Ready
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, close 3 wide, through after half,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 16300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLACK BUTTE had speed from the start along the inside, dropped back and shifted out four wide, came on again under right handed urging and was along in time. ROSE RING prompted the pace four then two wide, gained a narrow lead after a quarter, dropped inside, set the pace until deep stretch, bumped nearing the wire then couldn't handle the winner. LILAC LACE set the early pace two wide, dropped ack after a quarter, shifted out three wide in the turn, came on again, matched strides through the final furlong, bumped nearing the wire and just missed. WOLF EYES pressed the pace three then two wide into the stretch and faded late while drifting out to the six path. SHEZA HOOT failed to menace. SWEET EMPIRE trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Sheza Hoot
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Black Butte
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, dropped back, came again, 4 wide, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Lilac Lace
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead 2w, dropped back, came again 3w, bumped late, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Rose Ring
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 4-2wide, led, bumped late, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Wolf Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3-2wide, faded late, drifted out 6path

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 66. Allowance Purse 35800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HELLO SWEETS bore out at the start, was allowed to settle, closed willingly three wide into the stretch, made the lead near the furlong marker while under left handed urging and drew clear. BROWNIE trailed for nearly a half, rallied in the four path and finished second best. EXACTITUDE pressed pace along the inside into the turn, made the lead, set the pace until deep stretch then was outfinished. LADY JASPER stalked the pace and went evenly. SERGER close up early, dropped back on the turn then passed tiring rivals. GLIMMERGLASS broke alertly, set a pressured pace until midway on the turn then was used up. TALE OF THE LYON had brief speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Tale of the Lyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, inside, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Brownie

ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 4path late, second best,
